Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Exercise and Nutritional Intake Post-Oesophagectomy

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to a 12-week exercise intervention or usual care.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to a 12-week exercise intervention or usual care.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the impact of a 12-week supervised exercise programme on energy and protein intake, body composition, and malnutrition risk.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was quality of life, with secondary outcomes including dietary intake and body composition.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 120 participants, 79 were invited for dietetic measurements, and 37 consented.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The exercise group showed a non-significant weight reduction compared to controls (−1.19 kg, 95% CI −2.48 to 0.10).
